subject: Re: Help with Junitreport
msgSnippet: Brendan Thanks for the prompt reply. Here we go.. (this is the entire build.xml..) ...
messageBody:
Brendan
Thanks for the prompt reply. Here we go.. (this is the entire
build.xml..)
------------snippet starts----------------
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project basedir="." default="all" name="servlets">
<!-- Written to assume that classpath is rooted in the current
directory. -->
<!-- So this should be OK if you make this script in the root of a
filesystem. -->
<!-- If not, just change src.dir to be the root of your sources'
package tree -->
<!-- and use e.g. View over a Filesystem to mount that
subdirectory with all capabilities. -->
<!-- The idea is that both Ant and NetBeans have to know what the
package root is -->
<!-- for the classes in your application. -->

<!-- Don't worry if you don't know the Ant syntax completely or
need help on some tasks! -->
<!-- The standard Ant documentation can be downloaded from
AutoUpdate and -->
<!-- and then you can access the Ant manual in the online help.
-->

<taskdef resource="cactus.tasks">
<classpath>
<pathelement location="lib/cactus-1.5.jar"/>
<pathelement location="lib/cactus-ant-1.5.jar"/>
<pathelement location="lib/commons-htt
pclient-2.0-rc2.jar"/>
<pathelement location="lib/commons-logging-1.0.3.jar"/>
<pathelement location="lib/aspectjrt-1.1.1.jar"/>
</classpath>
</taskdef>

<target name="init">
<property location="classes" name="classes.dir"/>
<property location="src" name="src.dir"/>
<property location="/usr/local/tomcat50" name="tomcat.dir"/>
<property location="${tomcat.dir}/bin" name="tomcatbin.dir"/>
<property
location="/usr/local/tomcat50/webapps/test/WEB-INF/classes"
name="deploy.dir"/>
<property location="/usr/local/tomcat50/common/lib"
name="libs.dir"/>
<property name="project.name" value="${ant.project.name}"/>
<property location="webapp" name="src.webapp.dir"/>
<property location="test-reports" name="testreports.dir"/>

<property location="jars" name="jars.dir"/>
<mkdir dir="${jars.dir}"/>
</target>

<target depends="init" name="compile">
<!-- Both srcdir and destdir should be package roots. -->
<mkdir dir="${classes.dir}"/>
<javac debug="true" deprecation="true"
destdir="${classes.dir}" srcdir="${src.dir}">
<!-- To add something to the classpath: -->
<classpath>
<fileset dir="${libs.dir}">
<include name="**/*.jar"/>
</fileset>
</classpath>
<!-- To exclude some files: -->
<!-- <exclude name="com/foo/SomeFile.java"/><exclude
name="com/foo/somepackage/"/> -->
</javac>
</target>

<target depends="init,TestAtOnce" description="Build everything."
name="all"/>

<target depends="init" description="Clean all build products."
name="clean">
<delete dir="${classes.dir}"/>
</target>

<!-- <target description="Start Tomcat" name="start.tomcat50">
<exec dir="${tomcatbin.dir}"
executable="${tomcatbin.dir}/startup.sh"/>
</target>
<target description="Stop Tomcat" name="stop.tomcat50">
<exec dir="${tomcatbin.dir}"
executable="${tomcatbin.dir}/shutdown.sh">
<arg line=""/>
</exec>
</target>
-->


<target name="TestAtOnce" depends="compile">
<jar destfile="${jars.dir}/myjars.jar" bas
edir="${classes.dir}"/>
<war warfile="test.war"
webxml="${src.webapp.dir}/WEB-INF/web.xml">
<lib dir="${jars.dir}"/>
<lib dir="${libs.dir}"/>
</war>
<!-- Cactify the web-app archive -->
<cactifywar srcfile="test.war" destfile="test-cactified.war">
<servletredirector/>
<jspredirector/>
</cactifywar>
<cactus warfile="test-cactified.war" fork="yes"
failureproperty="tests.failed" haltonerror="true">
<!-- The following addition of jars.dir (for myjars.jar)
to classpath seems redundant.
But then only it works!! -->
<classpath>
<fileset dir="${jars.dir}">
<include name="**/*.jar"/>
</fileset>
</classpath>
<classpath>
<fileset dir="${libs.dir}">
<include name="**/*.jar"/>
</fileset>
</classpath>
<containerset>
<tomcat5x dir="${tomcat.dir}" />
</containerset>
<formatter type="plain"/>
<batchtest>
<fileset dir="${src.dir}">
<include name="**/Test*.java"/>
<exclude name="**/TestAll.java"/>
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</cactus>
<!-- Generate the JUnit reports -->
<junitreport todir="${testreports.dir}">
<fileset dir="${testreports.dir}"
includes="TEST-*.xml"/>
<report todir="${testreports.dir}"
format="frames"/>
</junitreport>
</target>
</project>
----snippet ends----

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Brendan Humphreys <brendan@t...> wrote:
> Shan,
>
> Can you post the <junitreport> fragment of your build file? This
will
> help with tracking down the problem you are experiencing.
>
> Cheers,
> -Brendan
> http://www.thecortex.net
>
>
> shankris72 wrote:
> > I am a newbie with Cactus. I think I can run my tests fine. I do
see a
> > TEST-<testcaseclass>.xml file generated. However the JUnitReport
(ant)
> > task does not generate the correct report. The report states 0
tests run
> > whereas the TEST-<testcaseclass>.xml file correctly identfies two
> > cases (one expected failure and one success).
> > Please note that I have xalan.jar and xercesImpl.jar in my
CLASSPATH.
> > I run ant 1.5.4 with cactus-13.1.6.1
> > I wonder if this is a configuration issue at my end.
> > Any pointers will be highly appreciated.
> > Shan.
> >
> >
